aufilmmaking.co.uk

BMD Slate

aufilmmaking.co.uk

In 2019, being vice-president of the Aberdeen University Filmmaking Society, I designed and wrote a website in order to streamline our equipment booking system, the way we would vote during meetings, and serve as a database for everything produced by the society.

The front-end of the website is vanilla HTML+CSS+JS, served from an Express.js + MySQL back-end. In order to minimize hosting costs (Â£3/month), while including powerful features (such as a real-time voting system), the website does not rely on a pre-existing CMS: The back-end was tailor-made for the specific needs of AUFS.

Voting system

AUFS often holds votes, for example to elect the following year's committee, or to vote on which film pitches will be produced by the society. The website therefore includes a real-time voting system, where members of the society are able to cast ballots from their phone, while the results are simultaneously updated (generally projected in a lecture hall). The administrator has access to a variety of settings, such as changing the type of vote (First Past the Post vs. Ranked) or the visibility of the results (real-time, or once the vote has been closed).

Equipment booking system

Members of AUFS are able to book equipment, free of charge. The website facilitates this process by allowing members to submit booking requests online, which can then be accepted, edited, or refused by the Equipment Manager (updates are sent through automated emails, and are visible on a unique URL for each booking request). This central booking calendar helps the society's committee know exactly where the equipment is, who last had it, for how long, etc...

Other features

The website includes a lot of other features, such as a Blogging system, Audition forms, a Film Database, a Tagging system (used to suggest 'related' films). A more precise breakdown can be found in the website's user manual
